This vignette provides examples on how to use different plotting functions.

```{r, eval=TRUE, message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(babynames)
library(rrplot2)
```

# Bar chart

```{r setup, out.width='100%'}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = factor(cyl),
             fill = factor(am))) +
  theme_RR() +
  geom_bar_RR() +
  labs(title = "Number of Cars per Number of Cylinders", 
       x = "Number of Cylinders", 
       y = "Count") +
  scale_fill_RR()
```

# Scatter plot (discrete palette)

## Example 1

```{r, out.width='100%'}
iris |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length, 
             y = Sepal.Width, 
             color = Species)) +
  theme_RR() +
  geom_point_RR() +
  labs(title = "Scatterplot of Sepal Dimensions", 
       x = "Sepal Length", 
       y = "Sepal Width") +
  scale_color_RR()

```

## Example 2

```{r, out.width='100%'}
mpg |> 
  ggplot(aes(cty, 
             hwy, 
             color = factor(cyl))) +
  theme_RR() +
  geom_jitter_RR() +
  scale_color_RR()
```

# Scatter plot (continuous palette)

## Red

```{r, out.width='100%'}

  ggplot(aes(x = hp, 
             y = mpg,
             color = cyl)) +
  theme_RR() + 
  geom_point_RR() +
  labs(x = "Horse power", 
       y = "Miles per gallon",
       fill = "Cylinders") +

```

# Density plot

```{r, out.width='100%'}
# Generate example data
set.seed(123)
data <- data.frame(
  Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200),
  Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1))
)

# Create density plot
data |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) +
  theme_RR() +
  geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(x = "Value", y = "Density",
       fill = "Group") +
  scale_fill_RR()

```

# Line chart (simple)

```{r warning=FALSE, out.width='100%'}
# Load dataset
data("babynames")
data <- babynames |> 
  filter(name %in% c("Mary", "Ashley", "Amanda",
                     "Jessica", "Patricia", "Linda", 
                     "Deborah", "Dorothy", "Betty")) |>
  filter(sex=="F")

# Plot
data |>
  ggplot(aes(x = year, 
             y = n, 
             group = name, 
             color = name)) +
  theme_RR() +  
  geom_line_RR() +
  scale_color_RR()
```

# Line chart (faceted)

```{r, fig.height=8, out.width='100%'}
tmp <- data |>
  mutate(name2=name)

RR_dark_blue <- "#193271"

tmp |>
  ggplot(aes(x = year, 
             y = n)) +
  theme_RR() +
  geom_line(data = tmp |> dplyr::select(-name), 
               aes(group = name2),
               color = "grey", 
               linewidth = 0.5, 
               alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_line(aes(color = name), 
               color = RR_dark_blue, 
               linewidth = 1.2)+
  scale_color_RR() +
  facet_wrap(~name) +
  theme(axis.line = element_blank()) +
  labs(y = "Count",
       x = "Year")

```

# Heat map

## Blue

```{r, out.width='100%'}
# Dummy data
x <- LETTERS[1:20]
y <- paste0("var", seq(1,20))
data <- expand.grid(X=x, Y=y)
data$Z <- runif(400, 0, 5)
 
# Heatmap 
data |> 
  ggplot(aes(X, 
             Y, 
             fill= Z)) + 
  geom_tile() + 
  theme_RR() +
  scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue()
```

## Red

```{r, out.width='100%'}
data |> 
  ggplot(aes(X, 
             Y, 
             fill= Z)) + 
  geom_tile() + 
  theme_RR() +
  scale_fill_continuous_RR_red()
```
